item.title: Composing Music With Recurrent Neural Networks
item.description:
Composing Music With Recurrent Neural Networks

It's hard not to be blown away by the surprising power of neural networks these days. With enough training, so called "deep neural networks", with many nodes and hidden layers, can do impressively well on modeling and predicting all kinds of data.

item.title: Puppyslugs 'R Us: Part 1
item.description:
Puppyslugs 'R Us: Part 1

In " Puppyslugs 'R Us: Part 0 ", I started out quite cheekily on a topic I hope to explore here in a bit more serious detail. Intro I am going to start with the recent Google "DeepDream" release and the so-called Puppyslug images you've likely encountered, explaining roughly what those are and how they come to be.

item.title: Defeating Facebook's DeepFace with Deep Dreams
item.description:
Defeating Facebook's DeepFace with Deep Dreams

AI Is Already Here, And We've Barely Noticed AI is infiltrating our lives, in much the same way mobile did before it. It's being fueled by the massive amounts of data we humans are generating from our phones, and it's begun to radically change the way we interact with our machines.

item.title: Welcome to the AI Conspiracy: The 'Canadian Mafia' Behind Tech's Latest Craze
item.description:
Welcome to the AI Conspiracy: The 'Canadian Mafia' Behind Tech's Latest Craze

In the late '90s, Tomi Poutanen, a precocious computer whiz from Finland, hoped to do his dissertation on neural networks, a scientific method aimed at teaching computers to act and think like humans. As a student at the University of Toronto, it was a logical choice.

item.title: Comparing the hallucinations of four similarly trained neural nets
item.description:
Comparing the hallucinations of four similarly trained neural nets

Before training my own dreaming network, I'll need to choose a network layout that suits my needs. In order to learn about the strengths and weaknesses of different layouts, I've run the same guided dreaming tour with four different Imagenet-pretrained models: GoogLeNet, VGG CNN-F, VGG CNN-S and Network-in Network Imagenet model (all available via Caffe model zoo).

item.title: Deep Convolutional Inverse Graphics Netw...
item.description:
Deep Convolutional Inverse Graphics Netw...

Deep Convolutional Inverse Graphics NetworkResearch paper from MIT uses deep learning and neural networks to 'hallucinate' a 3D face from a 2D image:Deep Convolution Inverse Graphics Network (DC-IGN), a model that learns an interpretable representation of images.
